meta.title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) - Lac Qui Parle Valley ISD

meta.content: The Distance Learning period, intended to provide continuity of education, begins on March 30, 2020 and extends through May 4, 2020.

meta.name: description
meta.content: The Distance Learning period, intended to provide continuity of education, begins on March 30, 2020 and extends through May 4, 2020.

form.name: aspnetForm

span.p: Lac qui Parle Valley Schools Distance Learning Plan will remain in effect until the last day of school, Friday, May 22nd due to COVID-19 containment strategies. Read More

div.class: hidden-xs col-sm-4 col-md-3 col-lg-3 backgroundcolor leftPanel

span.strong: Click Here to visit our Distance Learning Page

span.p: Due to the COVID-19 Pandemic, the Lac qui Parle Valley Prom, originally scheduled for May 2, is being postponed. The plan is to find two alternative dates. Option #1 would be a date in June and Option #2 would be a date in July. If the COVID-19 Pandemic pushes into the date that is selected for July, Lac qui Parle Valley would be forced to make the difficult decision to cancel prom for the 2020 school year.

One of the challenges we are facing is to find a site, as the Lac qui Parle Valley schools will be under construction during the summer months. The other concern that the prom/daybreak committee is working through is finding a date that works for the entertainment and vendors that have been reserved for the original May date. Lac qui Parle Valley will continue to inform our students, parents, and community members on the outcome of the 2020 prom festivities.
Breakfast/Lunch Sign-Up (Ages 18 & under) (please register by 10:00 am to receive a meal for the following day)

Breakfast/lunch delivery will occur on regular school days beginning Monday, March 30th through Monday, May 4th. Students will receive 1 breakfast and 1 lunch at the same time for each child. Please register for these services. Once you have registered for this service, you will receive meals until in-person school resumes.
Sign up once for each student.

span.b: Child Care Sign-up (for Health Care/Emergency Workers)

span.p:
Per the guidance of the MN Department of Education, schools should provide care to, at a minimum, district- and charter-enrolled students aged 12 and under who are children of emergency workers critical to the State’s response to COVID-19.
Emergency staff is defined as:
-Health care providers and systems, including hospitals and clinics
-Post-acute and long-term care facilities, including nursing and assisted living facilities
-Other health systems and organizations, such as:
-Home Care workers
-Personal Care Assistants
-Ambulance/emergency
-Direct Care and Treatment
Other emergency staff, including:
-First responders
-Firefighters
-Personnel providing correctional services
-Essential Court personnel
-Minnesota State Veterans Homes staff
-State and local public health agency employees
-MNsure Navigators

-County financial/eligibility workers
-County case managers
-Or any county staff in emergency management or health and human services
Please register for these services. Child Care Sign-up
